paper_abstract: We provide an estimate, sharp up to poly-logarithmic factors, of the asymptotic almost sure mixing time of the graph created by long-range percolation on the cycle of length N (Z/NZ). While it is known that the asymptotic almost sure diameter drops from linear to poly-logarithmic as the exponent s decreases below 2 [4, 9], the asymptotic almost sure mixing time drops from N(2) only to N(s-1) (up to poly-logarithmic factors).
